Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the length of time that unemployment has been running near 12 percent or more, stating that it has been the case for the last four years.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the statement that the Legislature hasn't done much to lower unemployment.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the high unemployment rate can be solely attributed to the Legislature's inaction, without considering other factors that may have contributed to it.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the high unemployment rate, such as the impact of the recession or other economic factors.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that unemployment figures started creeping up in 2008, which was before the Legislature's alleged inaction.
